AveragePooling2D¶

class layers.AveragePooling2D.AveragePooling2D(pool_size=(2, 2), stride=None)[source]¶

Implements an AveragePooling layer for 2D inputs (e.g., images).

AveragePooling is a downsampling operation that reduces the spatial dimensions (height, width) of the input by taking the average value over a defined window.

pool_size¶

The size of the window to average pool over.

Type:

tuple

stride¶

The step size of the pooling window.

Type:

tuple

backward(output_gradient)[source]¶

Performs the backward pass of the AveragePooling layer.

Distributes the incoming gradient equally among all the elements in the original pooling window.

Parameters:

output_gradient (np.ndarray) – The gradient of the loss with respect to the output of this layer.

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • The gradient with respect to this layer’s input.

  • None, since this layer has no trainable parameters.

Return type:

tuple[np.ndarray, None]

forward(input_data)[source]¶

Performs the forward pass of the AveragePooling layer.

Parameters:

input_data (np.ndarray) – The input data with shape (batch_size, input_height, input_width, channels).

Returns:

The downsampled output with shape

(batch_size, output_height, output_width, channels).

Return type:

np.ndarray
